revised_title: Analyzing a New Aluminous Mineral from Devonshire
tldr: Humphry Davy examines a mineral found in Devonshire, which consists mainly of alumine and water. He conducts various experiments to understand its properties and composition. The mineral is found to be a chemical combination of about 30 parts of water and 70 parts of alumine. Davy suggests calling it Hydrargillite.
